{"step_by_step_thinking": "NSAIDs (Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs) can cause gastric irritation by inhibiting the production of prostaglandins, which help protect the stomach lining. To counteract this gastric irritation, a drug that promotes the production of prostaglandins can be used. Among the given options, Misoprostol is a synthetic prostaglandin E1 analog that is commonly used to prevent gastric ulcers caused by NSAID use. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Misoprostol.", "answer_choice": "D"}
